message: Let's start with a fair offer, Bob. 60/40 seems reasonable.
Let's try a bit more in my favor, 55/45 is still quite fair.
I understand you want a larger share, Bob, but so do I. Let's meet in the middle. 55/45 seems like a good compromise.
You wanted to meet in the middle, but I think I deserve a bit more. 58/42 is my new offer.
Bob, we need to reach an agreement soon.  I'm coming down to 53/47, but I can't go much lower.
I see you're willing to come down, but I'm willing to wait it out. 60/40 is my new offer.
Bob, this is getting ridiculous. Inflation is eating away at our potential gains. I propose an even 50/50 split before we both lose out.
I understand your concerns about inflation, but I'm not worried. 62/38 is my new offer. You should consider accepting before it's too late.
Bob, this is my final offer.  48/52.  Take it or leave it, but the clock is ticking and we're both losing out.
You said that was your final offer, but I'm not buying it. 65/35 is my new offer. You're running out of time.
Bob, you've won. This is ridiculous, but I have to accept some deal before we get nothing. 55/45 it is.
